message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the function of the brain in animals. The brain controls the body and all its functions, so option (A) is the correct answer. Option (B) is incorrect because the brain does not control other animals. Option (C) is incorrect because the brain does not control plants. Option (D) is incorrect because "fauna" refers to a collection of animal species, not the brain's control.

This question requires basic knowledge about the role of the brain in animals. The brain is responsible for controlling and coordinating the various functions and activities of an animal's body. Option (B) is incorrect because an animal's brain does not control other organisms. Option (C) is incorrect because plants do not have brains. Option (D) is incorrect because fauna refers to a category of animals and not the brain itself.
